Pre-Game Insights: Scotland captain Andy Robertson emphasized the importance of the match, stating, 'We know that's what's at stake. We have to be at our best and if we can do that, who knows where we'll be come 23 June.'

Scotland manager Steve Clarke reflected on the team's journey, saying, 'It's been a long time since 1998 when we actually travelled abroad to appear in a tournament like this. We're proud we've been able to do back-to-back tournaments and hopefully by the end of this we'll be even more proud at having done something a bit more special.'

Defender Scott McKenna highlighted the fans' role, stating, 'It's a great opportunity for them to come and experience a tournament on foreign soil for the first time in a long time. I think the Tartan Army will be very excited, they're travelling in their numbers and I hope we can put in a performance they can be proud of and celebrate as well.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thousands of Scotland fans have travelled from the UK to Munich, with an estimated 200,000 fans expected to head over during the tournament.
